Chambal Safari Booking

We have made 4 kinds of Chambal Safari Booking options so that travelers can choose the one that suits them the most. These options are made according to different preferences of people over the last few years. Every traveler has different preferences some needs include lunch, and some need a pickup and drop service. In some options, we have included some necessities, and in some, we have not so that it can suit the budget. Check these options to make your safari a memorable one.

  • 1. In the first option, a Chambal boat safari along with a life jacket can be booked without a pickup & drop service.
  • 2. In the second option, you can book a chambal boat safari along with a life jacket and pickup & drop service from your hotel to your safari destination.
  • 3. In the third option, a chambal boat safari along with a life jacket can be booked with lunch included. But pickup & drop service will not be provided.
  • 4. Last but not least, in the fourth option, you can book a chambal boat safari along with a life jacket, lunch, and pickup & drop service from your hotel to your safari destination. All services are included in this one and it is the best if you truly want to enjoy a memorable boat safari in the Chambal river.

The Beauty of Chambal River

Chambal River is a widely visited tourist spot in Ranthambroe and it gives a chance of doing a safari inside it. Chambal boat Safari offers a unique way of exploring the marine life of Ranthambore National Park. This place is famous among people as the National Chambal Gharial Sanctuary and it is located in Palighat Village, Sawai Madhopur, India.

This village is located next to the Chambal River and offers an exciting boat safari inside the river. Chambal Gharial Safari is the best spot to explore the Crocodile, Gharial, Gangetic dolphin, marsh crocodiles, and smooth-coated otters with an amazing diversity of birdlife. Along with these sightings, people can see amazing views of striking landscapes because this river is surrounded by lush greenery.

This river is located around 45 km away from Ranthambore National Park and it covers a tri-state protected area of 2,100sq mi. In Rajasthan, this sanctuary covers an area of around 285 sq. km. This river has lots of Gharials and back on December 7, 1979, this place was established as National Chambal Gharial Wildlife Sanctuary to save the Gharials as they are rare species of crocodiles. They were smaller in number than tigers.

Gharial and the Crocodile are the main attractions of this place, and many tourists come here every year to see them. People can make Chambal safari online booking to spot them inside the river. This spot is the best in Rajasthan to spot amphibians and aquatic animals in their natural habitat. Not only Gharial, but this place also attracts tourists because the National Aquatic Animal Gangetic Dolphin can also be seen here. More than 316 species of birds call this place home and they can be spotted while experiencing a chambal boat safari at this spot.

What It Offers

Chambal boat safari takes place inside the Chambal River. Chambal gharial safari is way different that gypsy safari and canter safaris. On one hand, these safaris take place inside the Jungle and give you a chance to explore the park's wild animals, while on the other hand, the Chambal boat Safari lets you explore the aquatic and marine life of Ranthambore. If you choose to ride on the Chambal Boat Safari then you can see the crocodiles(gharials), turtles, Ganges dolphins, otters, and more than 320 species of birds including migratory ones. Some mentionable birds include the Sarus crane, Indian skimmer, Indian courser, and Pallas's fish eagle can also be seen here.

Chambal Safari Timings

Chambal gharial safari is a lot different than gypsy and canter safari. This safari does not happen just twice a day, it happens multiple times a day. To enjoy a Chambal gharial safari, you don’t have to wait for long hours or wait a lot, you can just simply book it online and enjoy a nice ride inside the river. Yes, you can make a chambal safari online booking and enjoy an adventurous boat safari near Ranthambore. The first boat goes inside at 08:00 am and the last safari takes place at 05:00 pm. After every hour, a safari goes inside the river so you can enjoy it without any problems. A 1-hour long safari takes place 10 times a day and you can make a chambal safari booking for the one that suits you the most.

Note: The first safari starts at 8:00 am and the last one takes place at 5:00 pm. The safari is conducted multiple times a day for 1 hour.

Chambal Safari Booking Details

  • This safari cannot be booked offline, you have to make an Online Chambal Safari Booking if you want to enjoy a ride in Chambal River. To book this ride, you can fill in the details like your name, phone number, date of your arrival, type of car you require, number of adults and children, age, gender, identity proof details, and other information. Just make sure to fill in the correct details.

  • You can book the Chambal gharial safari from ranthamboretigerreserve.in

  • There are 4 chambal safari booking options available on our site and you can book the one that suits you the most.

  • This safari is booked for 1 hour of ride inside the river and it happens from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. You can book it for any 1 hour between these times.

  • In total, 10 safaris take place in a day and it is advised to book in advance if you don’t want to face any future disappointments.

Rules That One Need To Follow During Chambal Boat Safari

National Chambal Gharial Sanctuary is not just a simple place. This spot has a lot of wild animals and even Gharials can be dangerous. For safety reasons, there are some rules and regulations and everyone needs to follow them when visiting this spot to enjoy the sights of gharial resting under the sun.

  • - Before sitting inside the boat, it is important for everyone to wear their life jackets. You cannot go on a chambal boat safari without wearing them.
  • - Don’t even think of going inside the water for swimming. This is a wild river and it can be dangerous.
  • - Don’t try to drink water from the river because it has a lot of different aquatic and marine life.
  • - Please don’t throw any waste or garbage inside the river. They can harm the species living inside this river. Carry an extra bag and throw your waste in it.
  • - Do not dip your feet or hands in water during your chambal gharial safari.
